items.sentence: Have you ever noticed that Tom never seems to smile?
I know that I have to do that. I just don't want to.
Tom wanted to know what Mary was doing in Australia.
Tom stayed in Australia with the rest of the family.
All the children were wearing the same color shirts.
Tom dressed up like a dog and started barking at me.
A can of beer tastes better after a hard day's work.
There are purple tulips next to my castle's windows.
I'm going to buy some rolls and a bit of smoked ham.
Do you find it difficult to adapt to new situations?
How much does it cost to send a letter to Australia?
Who's the person standing in front of that building?
We have more important matters to discuss right now.
Let's make good use of the remaining daylight hours.
It's rude to interrupt people while they're talking.
I'm not yet used to getting up early in the morning.
I don't like people asking me to do things for them.
I'm going to do that exactly three minutes from now.
I think that you should buy yourself a new umbrella.
I'm interested in learning how to cook Chinese food.
